sec.p: The number of offspring/female at weaning was similar between the sites (Fig. 4 inset). Atigun females averaged 0.2 offspring/female fewer in 2011, and 0.1 offspring/female more in 2012 than Toolik females. Because of a higher adult female density (>1 ind/ha), juvenile density was higher at Atigun than at Toolik in both years of the study (2011: > 1.25 offspring/ha more, 2012: > 2 offspring/ha more at Atigun than Toolik; Fig. 4).

div.p: Arctic ground squirrels offspring density (mean Â± SE) at weaning and at recruitment (pre-hibernation in early September) at Atigun (light blue) and Toolik (dark red) sites in northern Alaska. Inset shows number of offspring per adult female at weaning at Atigun (light blue) and Toolik (dark red).
